messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Lewisville, TX area
messages.msgSnippet: I used to live in Lewisville - before I moved here to Tucson almost 7 years ago. (And in Richardson as well, when I first moved to Texas when I was 12). Texas
messages.messageBody:
I used to live in Lewisville - before I moved here to Tucson almost 7 years
ago.
(And in Richardson as well, when I first moved to Texas when I was 12).
Texas is a great place to unschool! I know a few unschoolers in the area.
I'll check in with them about local groups & get back to you...

heather mclean

On 7/18/07, Kendrah Nilsestuen <carebear-79@...> wrote:
>
> Hi,
>
> My husband is looking at a possible job transfer to Lewisville, TX.
> Anyone in or around the area who could tell me how Unschooling
> friendly it is, and how Texas is in regards to homeschooling laws? I
> posted this on two lists, so sorry if you received it twice!
>

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Lewisville, TX area
messages.msgSnippet: I live in Richardson, about 30 minutes away.  Texas is VERY friendly towards homeschooling in general, and my wife and I are members of at least two (that I
messages.messageBody:
I live in Richardson, about 30 minutes away. Texas is VERY friendly towards
homeschooling in general, and my wife and I are members of at least two
(that I know of) local unschooling groups. The annual Rethinking Education
conference is held in Irving, or thereabouts, which is about 20 minutes away
from Lewisville. There's a bunch of us here.

As I understand homeschooling laws here in Texas, it actually rests on a
couple of court decisions. I don't believe we even have annual or regular
academic "equivalency" tests (y'all with older kids, correct me on this if
I'm wrong).

--Rob Saxon
DH to Seana for 10 years!
"Daddy!" to Genevieve (5.8) and Elissa (4.25)
